description: Set the execution environment and configure the resources that spawned and running processes are allowed to share.

text.run: Run the COMMAND in a pre-set execution environment.
text.show: Show the effective script for the given COMMAND and OPTIONS.
text.list: List the objects from this CATEGORY, removing all duplicates.
text.rebuild: Rebuild the json cache and exit.
text.install: Install scripts, using SHELL if any.
text.manage: Apply available presets, managing the running processes.

run: -n, --dry-run        display commands but do not run them
show: -u, --force-cgroup   run inside a matching cgroup, if any
list: -f, --from=DIRECTORY List only objects from this DIRECTORY
manage: --user           inside the slice of the current user
--all            inside either system or global user slice
version: -v, --version        show the program version and exit

run: The PRESET argument can be: 'auto' to apply the specific preset for the command, its rule, if any; 'cgroup-only' to apply only the cgroup properties of that rule, if found; 'default' to apply the special fallback preset; or any generic preset, a type.
The CGROUP argument can be a cgroup defined in configuration files.
The QUOTA argument can be an integer ranging from 1 to 99 that represents a percentage relative to the total CPU time available on all cores.
list: The CATEGORY argument can be 'rules', 'types' or 'cgroups', matching the extensions of configuration files.
The DIRECTORY argument can be a path from NICY_SEARCH_DIRS setting. When filtering per DIRECTORY, no duplicate is removed taking into account the priority between directories.
install: The SHELL argument can be a path to a supported shell (sh, dash, bash, zsh). Default value is /bin/sh.
The scripts are installed, when a specific rule is available, in SCRIPT_PATH, if given. Default value is $HOME/bin/nicy.
manage: The processes are managed when a specific rule is available.
Root credentials are mandatory with --system, --global and --all options.
